p: In December 2019, rumors began to spread about the prevalence of a new unknown pneumonia-like illness in Wuhan, the capital of Hubei Province in the People's Republic of China. Soon afterward, authorities reported a novel coronavirus as the causative agent of clusters of the new illness (WHO, February 11, 2020). COVID-19 was the name that the WHO designated for the disease caused by the novel coronavirus, designated 2019-nCoV and later severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) ( Gorbalenya, 2020). Since the beginning of the outbreak, infections have expanded rapidly into multiple simultaneous epidemics worldwide. At the time of writing, over 7.2 million confirmed COVID-19 cases and over 410,000 COVID-19-related deaths have been reported across more than 180 countries ( https://coronavirus.jhu.edu/map.html).
